channel.title: Posts on Jeffrey Cyphers Wright
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jeffrey Cyphers Wright

item.title: Hard Press
item.description: “Revenge of the Pleasure Seekers” by Jeffrey Cyphers Wright “Homage to Baudelaire” by Kathy Acker “telephone booth number 190” by Pedro Pietri “The Origin of Hai Ku” by Maureen Owen Poetry on postcards After moving to New York City in 1976 I began attending poetry readings and workshops at the Poetry Project at St. Mark’s Church. My first workshop was with Ted Berrigan who was very encouraging.

item.title: 2021 Events
item.description: August 11, Wednesday 6-8pm “Roses are Read” featuring Jan Castro, James Feast, Gena Gruz, Steve Luttrell, John Trause. An evening of Spoken Word and Poetry in conjunction with “A Daze of Rose,” art curated by Robert Curcio at Mizuma & Kips gallery, 324 Grand St. NYC. June 19th, 6-8pm “Good Trouble” at Atelier on Spring Gallery in Oyster Bay. Jeff and George Wallace read at the opening of this show of art by Regina Bartkoff, Max Blagg, Rick Prol, Jerelyn Hanrahan and others.

item.title: JCW on the WWW 2001-
item.description: Jeff’s poem “Gold Filter” on Global Poemic. “Bustout Nation” a recording of the May 24, 2021 La Mama and Poetry Electric live event hosted by Jeff and William Electric Black and featuring Jeff’s puppet show, poetry by Penny Arcade, Jose Padua, and others, with art by Carl Hazlewood. “Tilt,” “Burning Rings,” “Echo’s Chamber,” “Here for You” on StatoRec March 2021 events A Downtown State of Mind: Part I, and Part II in collaboration with the New York Public Library: JCW hosts associated poets and artists in a celebration of LiVE Mag!

item.title: Pandemic Puppet Jam
item.description: As a deadly pandemic cripples the world, one man steps up to create a fantastical world of imagination — to keep his grandchild amused for 30 minutes, every day, for four months. — Seth Wright Preview producer

item.title: 2020 Events
item.description: Saturday, July 25, 5pm Lit Balm Reading Series presents LES Legends Ron Kolm, Thaddeus Rutkowski, Jeff Wright Check Facebook for Zoom invite May 13, 12:20pm English Radical Texts: Poetry, Politics, & Performance, Modern Poets for Modern People Trevor Day School Livestreaming Jeff on Facebook. February 16, Sunday at 3pm Boog City at Bowery Poetry Club Jeff reads with Andrei Codrescu and others February 13, 6:30 A reception and triple book launch for a new expanded Party Everywhere, with Barry Wallenstein’s Time on the Move and A.

item.title: Later Than You Think
item.description: released September 15, 2018 JCW – Guitar, harmonica, vocals, sound effects Lesley James Stephenson – Fiddle, guitar, vocals Erica Weiss – Fiddle, guitar, vocals Joseph Stephenson – Drum Later Than You Think by Jeffrey Cyphers Wright Mark Ari – Editor and Producer Dan Pike – Associate Producer Cover Art by Jeffrey Cyphers Wright Support artists producers of indie music and spoken word. Buy the Digital album for as little as $8.

item.title: NOLA Poetry Festival 18
item.description: JCW 2008 First cover of LiVE MAG! announcing the pre-festival reading at the landmark NOLA Tree of Life. View from LiVE MAG!s table in the Small Press Book Fair at this year's festival. Panel: Jenna Spagnolo, John Goslee, Elle Aviv Newton, Jeff. Photo by Alison Ross The Community and Collaboration panel Sunday 4⁄22 comrised Goslee, Spagnolo and Newton from Poets Reading the News, and LiVE MAG’s JCW.

item.title: Triller
item.description: Triller 2016 marker on handmade paper 8 x 8 in.

item.title: New Orleans Poetry Festival
item.description: Jeff reading at Cafe Istanbul. Photo by Alison Ross
